results.title: A Half million teenagers
results.brief_description: Studies the physiology aspects of venereal disease. Uses animation to show how the organisms of gonorrhea and syphilis enter and affect the body and how the diseases may be recognised. Stresses the need for treatment, pointing out that there is a cure for both diseases.

results.title: A Gumby adventure
results.brief_description: Relive your favourite Gumby moments in this compilation tape as Gumby and Pokey are involved in an assortment of adventures and mishaps. Episodes include; WITTY WITCH, Gumby and Pokey are kidnapped by a helicopter-flying witch; HOT ROD GRANNY, an elderly lady takes Gumby’s car for a spin after she mistakes it for hers after breaking her glasses; IN A FIX, there mischief afoot among Gumby and Pokey’s toys and a couple of strange birds; KING FOR A DAY, Gumby saves the kingdom of Ott by jousting; THE GROOBEE, Gumby rides a giant bee on an animal hunt; GOPHER TROUBLE, a chemist gopher alters the appearance of corn plants into giant corn ears; RAIN FOR ROO, Gumby shows King Ott how to make rain for his dry kingdom; CHICKEN FEED, Gumby is stuck with a chicken the size of a house; THE ZOOPS, Gumby is sold a magic potion that turns watermelons into strange animals that cry “zoop”.

results.title: A guide to landscape painting with Del Newport
results.creator_credit: Leigh Kidd, Val Osborn, Robert Dunn and Coral Coast Video
results.brief_description: Del Newport, prominent teacher and exhibition artist with national and overseas recognition shows step by step the fine detail and intricacies of landscape painting. As she paints a landscape from memory, Del explains what she is doing and why.

results.title: A Great white bird
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, Desmond Dew, Colin Low and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film documents the efforts of a group of people in Canada and the United States to sav the whooping crane from extinction. They display great determination and resourcefulness in their dealings with this mysterious, fiercely independent pre-Ice Age creature.

results.title: A Great wall
results.creator_credit: Peter Wang, Shirley Sun, Nanhai Film Company and W and S Productions
results.brief_description: In this culture-clash drama, the first American production to be shot in mainland China, Fang, a San Francisco computer engineer decides to return with his family to his home country of China in search of his “roots”. From the moment they arrive, they’re engulfed by basic differences in values, priorities and manners. For the first time in his life, Wang discovers what it is to be Chinese and not merely a hyphenated American, but his wife and children are not so easily assimilated into their new surroundings. Problems arise when the family moves in with their relatives, who are curious (and a little apprehensive) about Western culture. After many conflicts a common ground of mutual understanding and respect is reached.

results.title: A Great ship
results.creator_credit: John Reeve, Anthony Gilkison, British Information Services and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: P&O decided in 1955 to build the largest passenger liner since World War II, the Canberra. This documentary focuses on the construction of the vessel, followed by her maiden voyage.

results.title: A Great day to go
results.creator_credit: Hugh Macdonald, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A variety of people are shown enjoying water activities, e.g. surfing, boating, fishing. Through their thoughtlessness, tragedies occur in the water. Produced for the New Zealand National Water Safety Council.

results.title: A Grain of sand
results.creator_credit: David Keith Hardy, John Luck and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Firstly children’s needs are dramatised through a poem by William Blake and drawings by Ronald Searle. Then we follow a 10 year old Tunisian Arab boy to a health clinic, a school and a vocational training centre - three concrete ways to help meet children’s needs.

results.title: A Gourmet tour. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: The last decade has seen the emergence of an exciting and unique cuisine in Australia, arising from the multi-cultural nature of our society and the abundance of fresh, natural ingredients. This program is a gourmet’s tour of some of the best restaurants in the forefront of this development. It profiles the style of these famous restaurants, their chefs and details how to prepare some of their favourite dishes. Divided into three sections: Dining in Sydney and Dining with wine. Restaurants include Cleopatra’s, The Cellar, Berowra Waters, Taylors, Bangkok, The Barn, Cotswold House and Craigmoor.
